publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5073 Donald Gorrie: WHSmith—That the Parliament notes the evidence that WHSmith’s highly centralised buying system has, in recent years, produced a clear and unequivocal bias against Scottish interest material, which is very damaging to Scottish publishers and writers; calls on WHSmith and other national and major book retailers to sign up to a code of conduct on Scottish cultural material, and invites the Scottish Executive to become partners with the Parliament in promoting and monitoring such a code.

S2M-5073 WHSmith (lodged on 1 November 2006) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rob Gibson*, Campbell Martin*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Pringle*, Mark Ballard*, Chris Ballance*

S2M-5073 Donald Gorrie: WHSmith—That the Parliament notes the evidence that WHSmith’s highly centralised buying system has, in recent years, produced a clear and unequivocal bias against Scottish interest material, which is very damaging to Scottish publishers and writers; calls on WHSmith and other national and major book retailers to sign up to a code of conduct on Scottish cultural material, and invites the Scottish Executive to become partners with the Parliament in promoting and monitoring such a code. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Rob Gibson, Campbell Martin, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Eleanor Scott, Mike Pringle, Mark Ballard, Chris Ballance
S2M-5073 WHSmith (lodged on 1 November 2006) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-5073 WHSmith (lodged on 1 November 2006) Linda Fabiani*
